oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stones must not be thrown at the !kuerri-|nan (a little bird which is supposed to belong to the Rain). The evil effects of so doing exemplified in the case of the narrators cousin. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-21. 5698-5707). Children should respect swallows and not throw stones at them, for fear of being killed or made ill by sorcerers. Kki-a ||ken fainted and got ill after throwing stones at a swallow with some other little boys when he was a child.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Swallows
